WorkItem.ClosedComment:
As part of our move to GitHub, we're closing our CodePlex issues and suggestions and asking that people move them to the GitHub issue tracker for further discussion.  Some issues and feature requests may already be active on GitHub, so please make sure to look for an existing issue before filing a new one.

You can find our GitHub issue tracker here:
https://github.com/microsoft/typeScript/issues
WorkItem.Description: The file "encyclopedia\Encyclopedia.sln" is missing from the Windows 8 sample folder.

Comments.Message: You should be able to open the Encyclopedia.jsproj file, and Visual Studio will automatically create a solution for you.  The .jsproj is a Windows 8 Store App in JavaScript project type file, so you'll need Visual Studio 2012 or Visual Studio Express for Windows 8 - http://www.microsoft.com/visualstudio/eng/products/visual-studio-express-for-windows-8

You're right. The problem was that *.jsproj files were associated with the desktop version.

But I get the following error in the JavaScript console when I start the app:

    "APPHOST9623: The app couldnâ€™t resolve ms-appx://55019ts.encyclopedia/null because of this error: RESOURCE_NOT_FOUND."
It doesn't appear to affect the execution of the app (when not running in a debugger).  This might be a low-pri item to look at down the line.
Seconding Rob.  If that doesn't work for you, let us know.
